p: Milk catalase is a heme protein, molecular weight of catalase is 200 kDa, with isoelectric pH of 5.5, and this enzyme is stable in a wide range of pH 5-10 and rapidly loses activity when it is out of this pH range [ 169]. Most of the catalyzes contain heme, catalase causes the dismutation of H 2O 2, a chemical reaction in which H 2O 2 causes oxidation of the other H 2O 2 molecules, consequently, one is converted to O 2, and the other two are converted to two molecules of H 2O [ 177]. A polarographic method showed that average catalase activity in cow milk was 1.95 U/ml [ 178]. The concentration of catalase in human milk is approximately 10 times greater than cow milk [ 179].
